Border Collie

The Border Collie was originally developed in Scotland and thrived in the region on the border of Scotland and England. The word “collie” is a Scotch word used to describe sheepdogs. Because this breed flourished in the border region, it was christened the “Border Collie.”

  • Scientific Name: Canis lupus familiaris
  • Average Length: 50 centimenters
  • Average Lifespan: 12 years
  • Habitat: Pastures

The Border Collie is a working and herding dog breed developed in the Scottish borders for herding livestock, especially sheep. It was specifically bred for intelligence and obedience. It is very fetch-oriented.
